I don't know how up to date these [META] issues usually are, but I added a bunch of block related issues to:
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/1427

And I created a section for "Issues around block titles" which contains a number of overlapping issues, maybe duplicates. I think it would be good for someone to sort through some of these issues and close the duplicates.

[META] Blocks Blocks Blocks · Issue #1427 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Meta issue to help keep track of all the block related issues and initiatives, including converting the existing custom blocks into fieldable entities and creating a new type of custom text block t...
On it...

Having worked with Drupal8 for the past few years, one feature I really miss with Backdrop is fieldable blocks. I've looked through the issues and see some references to fieldable blocks or page-less nodes but I'm not quite sure where these stand. Is something still being considered? And if not, what do others use for Call-to-Action type blocks where you might want an image, subtitle, text, and button/link?

Hi, Danita Bowman. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
"Page-less" nodes are in Backdrop - the feature was adapted from Rabbit Hole module.
When configuring a content type you can configure it to not display the node on its own (except for those with explicit permissions)
Ah! Thanks. I totally missed that in the configuration. Guess I just wasn't aware of that until I started searching. But now I see it.
it's easy to miss
@Danita Bowman I think you could probably get something close with a hero block and the configurable block style module, although you would get more control if you made your own block type.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/configurable_block_style

backdrop-contrib/configurable_block_style
Ability to style blocks through UI. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/configurable_block_style development by creating an account on GitHub.

@Joseph Flatt Thanks! I looked at configurable block style module and it does get me part-way there. My own block type might be the way to go unless I am able to get a template for my page-less node type instead of having to make one for each node-block for that type. I'll keep working on it. Page-less nodes get me a little closer at this point.
I also have started a port of Display Suite which you might be able to use to control the layout of the pageless nodes without a template. I am not 100% sure that everything is working though.
@Joseph Flatt Is Display Suite ready for testing?
Yes, if you would like to try it out that would be great.
Actually, I think the modals are not working at the moment, so you might not be able to create the custom Display Suite fields.
Ok, thank you, it’s on my list.

@Danita Bowman are you referring to https://www.drupal.org/project/entity_block ? ...because as far as I know, the idea of fieldable blocks in Drupal core was rejected. See https://www.drupal.org/project/drupal/issues/430886 and https://www.drupal.org/project/drupal/issues/1833872 which were both closed as "won't fix". Perhaps if you explained what it is exactly that you are trying to achieve, then we could help you further.
...right. You must be referring to https://www.drupal.org/project/drupal/issues/1871772 and https://www.drupal.org/node/1933768 ...I missed those.

@klonos In D8 I can create a custom block type and add fields to it. I can then use these custom blocks in layout builder for things like CTAs (maybe an image, text, and button) with different display modes to have a CTA with an image on the left and text on right or at CTA with an Image on top and text on bottom, etc. Page-less nodes in Backdrop seem to provide similar function but I'm still trying to figure out how (or if possible) to change the layout in a template.
You can also use individual node fields in a layout, if you add the node/% context to it.
...you can then place individual fields in whichever region of the layout you want.
Custom block module is in core in D8. And yes, I used a layout on the page-less node I created but the layout isn't respected in the page where I added that page-less node block?
@Danita Bowman if I understand that seems right to me. I don't think we can do nested layouts
